pros: I will admit that I was able to learn quite a few skills that will be useful during my career.
cons: If you have aspirations of climbing the ladder and reaching the level of upper management, it seems to be a requirement that you are either from Coffee County, or have the minimum requirement of "letters behind your name" (M.D., CPA, etc), it is highly unlikely that you will ever become even a department director, much less an administrator.

pros: Great work environment, I really ever had a conflict with one coworker in my year and a half at CRMC. The management constantly reminds nurses to perform better care, such as completing central line  care, ensuring patients are receiving appropriate VTE prophylaxis, etc.
cons: CRMC has become too big for the size of the building. It really needs to be a bigger hospital at this point.

review_title: They are all about the Buck, concern about the patient is a front.
pros: The best reason to choose CRMC for a place of employment is the different shifts and making the shift differential pay.
cons: Challenges with working at CRMC come when you need to know that this facility will back you in the time of need as an employee, IT IS NOT GOING TO HAPPEN!  If you are not in a certain clique, then you are OUT OF LUCK.  I have worked at this facility for years, in order to save them money, they will hire someone off of the street to replace someone with credentials and education just to keep from paying that educated person the money that they are worth.  They will fire the educated person for no reason at all just to save a dollar.  The person that is uneducated, the only knowledge they may have is the knowledge from medical coding.  How is that going to give a patient great, and safe patient care?  The practitioner is who will bring the money into the facility, the practitioner is the one that is treating and reassuring the patient that CRMC is the best place to be, the practitioner is the one who will go out and bring in the patients into the facility and usher their family members in, will talk up for the facility when others are trashing the facility and it's staff.  The practitioners does that not a billing or medical coding clerk, no not them, but the practitioner does.  CRMC has their priorities twisted and before long, they will see how far twisted values are going to get them.

review_title: I am a phlebotomist at CoffeeRegional and I have gained lots of experience
pros: Close to home very nice lab director and assistant good place to work very good patient care friendly atmosphere and caring coworkers
cons: Not enough help and pay need more specialty doctors to let the hospital grow need orthopedic doctors need doctors in all areas

review_title: The Facility is among the top rated in the state for patient care.
pros: Great people work here and there is room to grow.
cons: Poor budgeting for several years and the employees are paying for it.

pros: Opportunities to move up, good atmosphere, friendly people."
cons: Low pay, no paid holidays (you are forced to use "PTO hours" for paid time off if you want to get paid on a day when the office is closed).

review_title: Was a Great Hospital to work at

cons: Recent changes due to financial challenges
